key_points: Facebook's Chief Technology Officer (CTO), Mike Schroepfer, announced he will step down in 2022.
Schroepfer will be replaced by Andrew Bosworth, the current leader of Facebook's augmented and virtual reality division.
This leadership change highlights Facebook's strategic push into augmented and virtual reality.
Schroepfer has been with Facebook since 2013, and Bosworth joined the company in 2006.
After stepping down, Schroepfer will become a 'senior fellow' within Facebook, a new role focusing on recruitment and AI investments.
Mark Zuckerberg, CEO of Facebook, called Schroepfer 'a close friend' and highlighted his critical role in the company's developments.
Other recent executive departures from Facebook include David Fischer (Chief Revenue Officer) and Hugo Barra (VR leader).
Samidh Chakrabarti, a former Facebook director, expressed concern about Schroepfer's departure.
Bosworth's work is seen as foundational to Facebook's efforts in building the 'metaverse,' a digital space merging social and physical worlds.
Zuckerberg has expressed a vision for Facebook to transition into a 'metaverse company,' emphasizing its future direction.
spokespersons: Andrew Bosworth (Facebook Augmented and Virtual Reality Division Leader)
Samidh Chakrabarti (Former Director of Product Management, Facebook)
